name: You need to respond to the application (Notice of Proceedings) NOP RE1 (service inside UK)
body:
#Notice of proceedings

Case number: ((reference number))

Dear ((first name)) ((last name))

Your ((partner)) has applied ((isDivorce??for a divorce))((isDissolution??to end your civil partnership)). You need to respond to their application by ((review deadline date)).

#What you need to do
1. Create an online ((isDivorce??divorce account))((isDissolution??account to end your civil partnership)): ((create account link))
2. Enter your reference number: ((reference number))
3. Enter your access code: ((access code))
4. Review and respond to their application 

If itâ€™s past ((review deadline date)), then you can still try and respond using the instructions above. If it's too late then the online service will tell you what you can do next. 

If you do not respond then your ((partner)) can ask the court to progress ((isDivorce??the divorce application))((isDissolution??application to end your civil partnership)) without you. You may have to pay extra fees if this happens.

^ You must only respond to this ((isDivorce??divorce application))((isDissolution??application to end your civil partnership)) if you are ((first name)) ((last name)). You could be fined or imprisoned for contempt of court if you access this service illegally. 

#Help and assistance
You can find guidance on these websites:
GOV.UK: ((isDivorce??https://www.gov.uk/divorce))((isDissolution??https://www.gov.uk/end-civil-partnership))
Citizens Advice: ((isDivorce??https://www.citizensadvice.org.uk/family/how-to-separate1/getting-a-divorce/))((isDissolution??https://www.citizensadvice.org.uk/family/how-to-separate1/ending-a-civil-partnership/))
Advicenow: https://www.advicenow.org.uk/guides/how-get-divorce-or-end-civil-partnership-without-lawyer
 
If you have any questions, then you can contact the ((isDivorce??divorce service))((isDissolution??End A Civil Partnership Service)) using the contact details below. The advisors cannot give you legal advice.

If you would like this email in Welsh then please email: ymholiadaucymraeg@justice.gov.uk. You will be able to request the rest of the notifications in Welsh when you respond to the application.  

Divorce and Dissolution
HM Courts & Tribunals Service
divorcecase@justice.gov.uk
0300 303 0642 (Monday to Friday, 8am to 6pm)

Your feedback helps improve this service for others: https://www.smartsurvey.co.uk/s/Divorce_Feedback/?pageurl=/email.
